trans-unit.source: Path and filename of the git executable, e.g. `C:\Program Files\Git\bin\git.exe` (Windows).
Configures when repositories should be automatically detected.
Scan for both subfolders of the current opened folder and parent folders of open files.
Scan for subfolders of the currently opened folder.
Scan for parent folders of open files.
When enabled, commits will automatically be fetched from the default remote of the current Git repository.
Duration in seconds between each automatic git fetch, when `git.autofetch` is enabled.
Controls what type of branches are listed when running `Checkout to...`.
A regular expression to validate new branch names.
The character to replace whitespace in new branch names.
Ignores the warning when Git is missing.
Ignores the warning when there are too many changes in a repository.
The default location to clone a git repository.
Commit all changes when there are no staged changes.
Control which changes are automatically staged by Smart Commit.
Suggests to enable smart commit (commit all changes when there are no staged changes).

Controls what changes are discarded by the `Discard all changes` command. `all` discards all changes. `tracked` discards only tracked files. `prompt` shows a prompt dialog every time the action is run.
Controls whether Git contributes colors and badges to the explorer and the open editors view.
Controls whether the Git Sync command appears in the status bar.
Controls whether Git should check for unsaved files before committing.
Check only for unsaved staged files.
Runs a git command after a successful commit.
Don't run any command after a commit.
Run 'Git Push' after a successful commit.
Run 'Git Sync' after a successful commit.
Controls whether to show an inline Open File action in the Git changes view.
Controls whether to show a notification when a push is successful.
Controls when to show commit message input validation.
Controls the commit message length threshold for showing a warning.
Controls the commit message subject length threshold for showing a warning. Unset it to inherit the value of `config.inputValidationLength`.
Controls whether to automatically detect git submodules.
Controls the limit of git submodules detected.
Always show the Staged Changes resource group.
Controls the signoff flag for all commits.
List of git repositories to ignore.
List of paths to search for git repositories in.
Controls whether git actions should show progress.
Force git to use rebase when running the sync command.
Always confirm the creation of empty commits for the 'Git: Commit Empty' command.
When enabled, fetch all branches when pulling. Otherwise, fetch just the current one.
Stash any changes before pulling and restore them after successful pull.
Controls whether force push (with or without lease) is enabled.
Controls whether force pushing uses the safer force-with-lease variant.
Controls whether to ask for confirmation before force-pushing.
Controls whether the diff editor should be opened when clicking a change. Otherwise the regular editor will be opened.
Controls whether a notification comes up when running the Sync action, which allows the user to cancel the operation.
Controls the sort order for branches.
All changes, tracked and untracked, appear together and behave equally.
Untracked changes appear separately in the Source Control view. They are also excluded from several actions.
Untracked changes are hidden and excluded from several actions.
Controls whether to show the commit input in the Git source control panel.
Controls whether to enable VS Code to be the authentication handler for git processes spawned in the integrated terminal. Note: terminals need to be restarted to pick up a change in this setting.
Controls whether to enable automatic GitHub authentication for git commands within VS Code.

A valid git installation was not detected, more details can be found in the [git output](command:git.showOutput). Please [install git](https://git-scm.com/), or learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code in [our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm). If you're using a different version control system, you can [search the Marketplace](command:workbench.extensions.search?%22%40category%3A%5C%22scm%20providers%5C%22%22) for additional extensions.

If you would like to use git features, please enable git in your [settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%5B%22git.enabled%22%5D). To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).

In order to use git features, you can open a folder containing a git repository or clone from a URL. [Open Folder](command:vscode.openFolder) [Clone Repository](command:git.clone) To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).

The folder currently open doesn't have a git repository. [Initialize Repository](command:git.init?%5Btrue%5D) To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).

The workspace currently open doesn't have any folders containing git repositories. [Initialize Repository](command:git.init) To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).

The workspace currently open doesn't have any folders containing git repositories. [Add Folder to Workspace](command:workbench.action.addRootFolder) To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm).
You can also clone a repository from a URL. To learn more about how to use git and source control in VS Code [read our docs](https://aka.ms/vscode-scm). [Clone Repository](command:git.clone)
It's not possible to change the commit message in the middle of a rebase. Please complete the rebase operation and use interactive rebase instead.
Current commit message only contains whitespace characters
Syncing. Cancelling may cause serious damages to the repository
The git repository at '{0}' has too many active changes, only a subset of Git features will be enabled.
Would you like to add '{0}' to .gitignore?
Git not found. Install it or configure it using the 'git.path' setting.
You seem to have git {0} installed. Code works best with git >= 2
Absolute paths not supported in 'git.scanRepositories' setting.
The '{0}' repository has {1} submodules which won't be opened automatically. You can still open each one individually by opening a file within.
Would you like Code to [periodically run 'git fetch']({0})?
Provide repository URL or pick a repository source.
Choose a URL to clone from.
Would you like to open the cloned repository?
Would you like to open the cloned repository, or add it to the current workspace?
Pick workspace folder to initialize git repo in
This will create a Git repository in '{0}'. Are you sure you want to continue?
Would you like to open the initialized repository?
Would you like to open the initialized repository, or add it to the current workspace?
HEAD version of '{0}' is not available.

There are {0} untracked files which will be DELETED FROM DISK if discarded.

This is IRREVERSIBLE, your current working set will be FOREVER LOST.

Are you sure you want to discard ALL changes in {0} files? This is IRREVERSIBLE! Your current working set will be FOREVER LOST.

Can't undo because HEAD doesn't point to any commit.
The last commit was a merge commit. Are you sure you want to undo it?
Please provide a new branch name
Branch name needs to match regex: {0}

trans-unit.source: Select a ref to create the '{0}' branch from
The branch '{0}' is not fully merged. Delete anyway?

trans-unit.id: select a branch to merge from
trans-unit.source: Select a branch to merge from
Please provide a message to annotate the tag
This repository has no remotes configured to fetch from.
Your repository has no remotes configured to pull from.
Pick a remote to pull the branch from
Pick a branch to pull from
Your repository has no remotes configured to push to.
Force push is not allowed, please enable it with the 'git.allowForcePush' setting.

You are about to force push your changes, this can be destructive and could inadvertedly overwrite changes made by others.
Are you sure to continue?
Please check out a branch to push to a remote.
The branch '{0}' has no upstream branch. Would you like to publish this branch?
Pick a remote to publish the branch '{0}' to:
This action will push and pull commits to and from '{0}/{1}'.
Your repository has no remotes configured to publish to.
Pick a provider to publish the branch '{0}' to:
There are no changes to stash.
There are no stashes in the repository.
Please clean your repository working tree before checkout.
Can't push refs to remote. Try running 'Pull' first to integrate your changes.
There are merge conflicts. Resolve them before committing.
There were merge conflicts while applying the stash.

Failed to authenticate to git remote:
{0}
Failed to authenticate to git remote.
Make sure you configure your 'user.name' and 'user.email' in git.
